baseline_noise.definition:
The standard deviation of the baseline
         membrane potential.

baseline_rate.definition:
For spiking cells, the spontaneous activity
         which might be an indicator for the cell's health status and
         thus recording quality.

brain_region.definition:
The region the cell is located in. For example
         Retina, Cortex, Cerebellum etc.

brain_sub_region.definition:
More detailed specification of the region the
         cell is located in. For example, if BrainRegion is
         "hippocampus", then the BrainSubRegion may be "CA1".

definition.content:
Specification of the recorded cell. A cell definition
should be a subsection of the

ganglion.definition:
Like the pro-, meta- and mesothoracal ganglion
         in invertebrates.

input_resistance.definition:
The input resistance of the recorded
         cell.

layer.definition: The name of the layer. For example, layer 4 in CA1.

recording_location.definition:
The recording location in the cell. E.g. axonal, dendritic,
         somatic, ...

resting_potential.definition:
What is the cells resting potential of the
         cell. An indiator for the recording quality.

rheobase.definition:
The minimum current required to make the cell
         fire action potentials.

structure.definition:
The structure of the organism the cell is
         located in e.g. Eye, Spinal cord...

type.definition: The type of the recorded cell. E.g. pyramidal cell.
